description: I'm really upset I've been across the street from this place this whole time and barely went for the first time the week I'm moving out. Don't be me. Eat here lol.
author: Esmie B.

description: Rude service. I get that you don't have breakfast during your break time of 10:30-11 but then I asked for a cappuccino for here. The lady then proceeds to tell me no cups for here even though I am looking at mugs right in front of me. She hands me a latte instead of a cappuccino.... blatantly lies twice.
author: Laila D.

description:
I love this place, and I'm shocked to see that it doesn't have more stars! I order almost weekly for people in my office, and every now and again get a salad for myself. 

The Greek Salad seems to be a favorite around the office, and they're always happy to modify dressings, or leave off cheese, etc.

The Nancy Sinatra sandwich is another must try! It's another office fav.

The sandwiches and salads are incredibly fresh, and they offer a really decent variety of foods without having an annoyingly large menu. 

They have some outside seating, and plenty of seating inside. The manager that works during weekday lunch is SO friendly and very accommodating - I had a mess up on my salad today, and she got me the right one super quick, and offered some tea while I as waiting.

Order on the Caviar app and save some money your first time!
author: Leah W.

description: Excellent service, fresh ingredients, delicious flavor combinations. I am full, but don't feel guilty for eating my entire sandwich. YUM!
author: Madison M.

description:
I've been here a few times with friends since it's close to my work and easy to get a quick lunch if your timing is right. It gets busy at lunchtime (as expected) but you can call ahead and order which is good :)

The staff is friendly and the food is pretty good. I especially like passing by in the morning when practically the whole block smells like bacon lol. I've tried a few of the sandwiches here and haven't been disappointed. They also serve size able portions of sandwich and salad, good for the price tag in sf ;)
author: Bianca C.

description: It is 10:33 and I called asking them if they can make me some toast with peanut butter. They say sorry no we start lunch in 30 min. And I said I am not ordering eggs or anything hard. Said they could even put the peanut butter on the side. I am really not feeling well and just wanted something simple. then he goes. Mam I said we start lunch in 30 min.... rude and come on really I can't order toast after 10
author: A Nicole M.

description:
I want to like this place, but no. The food is basic lunch fare and decently priced. But my issue with this place is the staff and their inconsistent hours. Multiple times I have tried to grab a late lunch only to be told the kitchen is closed 45 or an hour before the posted closing time. Some days it seems they simply invent a reason to close at 1:00 PM. Maybe Pazzo should consider amending the posted business hours. 

Don't trust Pazzo if you are looking for a late lunch option in the area. 

My hope is that management and ownership will be forced to address these inconsistencies now that many more options are opening in the neighborhood. It's never good to be inconsistent when the product you are selling is convenience.
author: Justin S.

description: Love this place. I went on a cold rainy day and order my soup. I order chicken noodle soup and Marco Polo salad. My order came quick with a friendly smile. Its a self service cute clean cafe. As soon I walked in saw everything clean and ready to serve.  Soup was delicious and very flavored. My salad was a very good looking salad. I asked dressing and nuts on the side. Serving was pretty big and colorful.  I really enjoyed celintro on the top of my salad. Love to go back and try few sandwich.  Seating area is very modern an luckily if downstairs get crowded you can go upstairs and enjoy your meal. Thanks Cafe Pazzo. See you soon :)
author: Annie A.

description:
The food won't blow you away but it's consistent and flavorful without being heavy. A variety of sandwiches and salads that will keep you from having to order the same thing all the time. My favorites are the seared ahi sandwich and Napa salad with seared ahi on top ($5 extra). Their non-seared ahi dishes are good too.

Pro tip: go upstairs to just get away from it all.
author: Gonzalo S.

description:
We like Pazzo's sandwiches a lot (the Nancy Sinatra is AMAZING!), but their catering order process leaves much to be desired.
Several times we have wanted to order sandwiches for delivery - they can do that but only a platter of 10 sandwiches. But you can't get extra sandwiches, so if we want to feed everyone in our office we either have to do 2 platters or do separate boxed lunches. I understand their catering kitchen has things they can and cannot do, but this just seems ridiculous. Why can't we order a platter and a couple extra sandwiches? We will of course pay for them at their regular price, that's not the issue.
Also, they are quite disorganized when you phone to place a catering order, even though their website says they will only accept catering orders before noon.
Unfortunately, we will not be attempting to order catering from Pazzo's again.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Pazzo is the go-to lunch spot in the SOMA.

Staff is always friendly, food rarely disappoints AND it's inexpensive, which is a major plus.  Their lunch rush gets pretty busy (12pm to 1:30pm) but despite this the staff is still very quick. I don't think I've ever spent more than 5-10 minutes waiting for my order during rush hour.  

My fave veggie options: Jane Fonda (breakfast sandwich), Napa Salad, Bambino Baguette, & Tomato Soup!

Added bonus: in the mood for tacos and beer?  Walk a few blocks to their sister restaurant Dos Pinas!
author: Vee S.

description:
I came 5 minutes before closing and the lady behind the counter was nice enough to still let me order. That actually helped my indecisiveness as I was forced to make a quick decision and chose the Grilled Cheese with one of the soup of the days. 

I sat next to one of their big windows and pulled out my laptop (though I later found out that the wireless didn't work) and ate my sandwich, which I was glad for because I was starved. The sandwich was really good. I liked the cheese (mozzarella), carmelized onions (which was actually a tad too carmelized), but the sun dried tomatoes was a nice touch. The soup (some mexican bean soup, I think) was really good. It had a good kick of spice as well.

Overall, it was a good place to grab a quick meal.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Every time I pass Caffe Pazzo, it's completely crowded. The wait is usually around 20-30 minutes. The food here is very average, but this shop gets so much traffic, it probably makes bank regardless of food quality.

That being said, this place makes decent light sandwich and salads. Don't expect any heavy foods.

Whatever you choose, just don't get the Ahi Tuna. The one I ordered was completely stale.
author: Nathan Y.

description: Stopped here for lunch and got their Thai Salad special.  Very pleased with the choice.  Recommend eating in because you get the feel of an Urban San Fran restaurant.  Additional seating is upstairs too.  The sandwiches were also great and the serving size is large enough.
author: Greg T.

description: Fresh crisp salads, love the Rico salad; the chicken salad and fruit in the salad are juicy and flavored well.
author: Teresa S.

description: Every time I come here, be patient, they are accommodating if you wait to long. I've been here plenty of times on the run and they always make sure the order is correct, so give them credit
author: B I.

description: Great place to grab a bite for lunch if you're in the area! Lunch rush = long line, but it goes pretty quickly. Haven't tried the sandwiches yet, but they make a pretty decent greek salad that I've gotten a handful of times. Super speedy too. My salad is usually ready less than five minutes after ordering it. Tables inside, outside, and upstairs. Overall solid place to grab some grub.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Standard office lunch spot with a line.

Pazzo is somewhat in the lobby of the Showplace building, so it feels a bit food court-y but more upscale. Food is 3 stars, but it's always so ridiculously packed that the only way to enjoy is is really to call ahead. We've rarely had issues with our orders and the guys here are definitely friendly enough for how busy they are.

If you order here, make sure to have your order ready, or you'll back up the line and folks behind you won't be so happy. They used to have a regular egg salad sammy that was quite delicious, but they don't always have the time to make egg salad anymore (that's how busy they are!). Some of the staples are the Nico, Tony Bennett, and Sinatra, and the Spiro's plate is a nice little mediterranean box (most of them about $10). Bonus points for being able to order anything "naked" (make it a salad) to accommodate casual or serious gluten-free diets!
author: Jade T.

description: Cafe Pazzo is a great find on the edge of the Potrero Hill/Soma area.  It is bright and airy with a large array of sandwiches and salads, all of which are delicious.
author: Katie P.

description: Tasty lunch place around the SoMA/Potrero/Design Center area. Their salads are just the right size... Spiro's Plate and the Greek Salad are my favorite, their daily specials are also delicious. Sandwiches, from what I hear from our co-workers, are also really amazing. And if it's a nice, sunny, token California day in San Francisco? Grab a table outside and get some of that sunshine. The wait can be long, I suppose good food takes time, but I never understood why it would take an average of 20 minutes to order a simple soup/salad combo. The key here is order online (try to order an hour and a half prior), identify your pick-up time, and grab your lunch as scheduled. And Caffee Pazzo - please put the Kale/Quinoa salad back on the dailies? Keep up the good work otherwise.
author: Jayr R.

description:
I'm a big fan of the Napa salad (Baby greens and romaine, cranberries, candied walnuts, blue cheese, house vinaigrette) - it's so yummy that I've never felt the inclination to veer from this order in the few years I've been coming to Pazzo. I'm boring that way (and also vegetarian, which limits the options to begin with). 

The lovely high ceilings indoors make this a pleasant destination, as does the outdoor seating when the weather's nice. However, as other reviewers have mentioned, the service can be pretty slow, and I've also seen a bit of attitude here and there. On the whole, though, I'm always up for Pazzo if a coworker suggests it for lunch, so I'll round up from the 3.5 stars I'd realistically award it..
author: Janna M.

description:
I want to give high marks. Seriously. Your Spiro plate is one of my favorites, and your sandwiches are tasty. 2/2 Stars for the grub. 

The 3 other stars that did not make it to my rating was the service and the long wait to get food. Am I just unlucky? I average 16 minutes before I get my order. Today was the clincher: 28 minutes for a salad. 

Figure it out, guys. Soon.
author: Cham M.

description: Solid lunch option in this part of town. Seared Ahi sandwich and Bambino baguette and the soups were solid.
author: Jeff F.

description:
Ok, Caffe Pazzo is kind of amazing. The "Famous Marco Polo" salad should really be famous.  it's nothing short of amazing.  the simple combination of Asian flavors combining chicken, cabbage, won tons, you name it, is stellar.  I've had a bite of the blue cheese Caesar and although I don't care for blue cheese the combination was great.

I'd recommend ordering online for an afternoon pick up since the wait can get kind of lengthy.  It's a popular lunch spot so be sure to grab a seat outside as soon as one opens up and there is plenty more seating upstairs too.  Soup and Sandwich combo will be my next venture...
author: Kevin J.

description:
During my first and only time that I visited Caffe Pazzo last week, I was quite under-impressed.  I ordered the vegetable brodo soup and a side greek salad.  The food was okay, definitely a solid 3 stars.  However, the service was extremely slow.  It took 20 minutes to get a small cup of soup (which is already made) and a salad (which takes 5 minutes to make).  I would understand if their was a line out the door, but it wasn't even that busy.   I get that this isn't a fast-food joint, but at a nice sit-down restaurant, it takes around 20 minutes to get your food.  The main concept: if you are going to be a "order-at-the-counter, pick-up-at-the-counter" place, than it should probably take around 10 minutes at most to pick up a small soup and salad.

Overall, it takes too long to get your food, but I guess if you place an order ahead of time by phone or online, than that gets rid of the problem!
author: Juliana K.

description: Great, accommodating staff, delicious food and quick service! Their sandwiches and salads are off the charts! I will be back next time I'm in the city!
author: Jessi K.

description:
I guess since I'm a regular now, the polite thing to do would be to grace Caffe Pazzo with my review.

What I've indulged on:

-Fellini sandwich (roasted chicken breast, asiago, arugula, tomato, lemon caper aioli, on an il Fornaio panino roll) 
-Tuna avocado melt (tomatoes, fontina, sliced country bread)
-Little grilled cheese (fontina + mozzarella, sun dried tomato tapenade, caramelized shallots, sliced walnut bread) + soup (New mexico white bean soup)

Great quality sandwiches, good portions, and fresh salads. 

Quick on phone orders, and lunch under $9 in Potrero Hill is pretty reasonable.
author: Lisandra M.

description:
Not a bad lunch spot, but there are items to stay away from.  Their tuna melt isn't great.  

Lots of places to sit (note there is an upstairs), plus some outdoor seating.  The complimentary bread with oil/balsamic is a nice touch.
author: Andrew R.

description:
This place is near my office, so I go here regularly. I have a hard time NOT ordering the Seared Ahi Fattoush salad every visit. It's amazing with its deliciously acidic vinaigrette dressing, fresh vegetables, crostini and PLENTIFUL ahi chunks. I get cravings for this salad when I'm not in the office.

Other delicious food options include the daily soups and cold sandwiches. Full disclosure, though, I haven't tried a warm sandwich yet. I have no doubt they are amazing, though.

In terms of online ordering, I've placed a few orders for pick-up and have never had an issue. Most times, though, I'll just walk over and order since the lunch line isn't too bad. A little pricey, but I like the healthy meal option in an area that isn't exactly food central.
author: Amanda E.

description:
I'm an admin for one of the high-tech companies in the immediate area and I liked going to Pazzo for the food (their Nancy Sinatra is very good).  However, I would say 9 times out of 10, I've dealt with unfriendly staff and horrible waits.  Actually, a couple of people who work there in particular are down-right rude and they are why I am now yelping.  
Some of my admin friends already boycott Pazzo; I will be joining them and spreading the word.  Rude service isn't worth my time nor my money.
author: Samantha K.

description: Love this place.  Everything is delicious and fresh.  Haven't had anything we don't enjoy.  Fantastic options and expansive menu.
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
I hate giving a bad review to a good restaurant. Pains me. But whoever is running this place needs to take note! I have been a long time patron of Cafe Pazzo, and I have finally hit the end of my rope. They have good food, but quite possibly the worst service in the industry. It's almost as if the customer is BOTHERING the staff to be there. Well, the message is loud and clear Pazzo, I wont BOTHER giving you any more of my money.

Today, ordering 2 salads was a nearly an impossible task. I called for 30 minutes straight, reaching an automated message with no voicemail. The phone was clearly off the hook. (I have personally seen them take the phone off the hook many times.)
Apparently they are still accepting FAX (seriously, who has a fax machine anymore?!!!!) for which they require 45 minutes to prepare. This is not industry standard.

So, I persistently drive over. As the only customer in the cafe I wait  for several minutes while multiple waiters chatted behind the counter, no one giving me a second glance. Their chatter sounded unimportant. When I finally interrupted and requested service I was told they were not ready for customers (although they had been technically open for some time...) and I was told to wait again.

Finally, I placed the order and waited for my number to be called. The salads sat on the counter and no one bothered to let me know. Lastly, once I got back to work I discovered they screwed up my order. 

Dear Pazzo, this is unacceptable.  I would not feel so strongly if this was a one time offensive. The ordering process is antiquated and your staff is not friendly or accommodating. Clearly poor management.
author: Lindsay G.

description:
This place is close to where I work, very convenient. (Considering there aren't many spots for food around this area.

I LOVE their Chicken Breast Salad with fresh fruit, its cheap and fresh. 

Tips: CALL IN EARLY to place the order.
author: Moto B.

description: yummy, friendly, quick. I will take it over starbucks any day
author: Maria L. M.

description: I have been comming to Pazzo for years and their service has taken a serious nose dive since Jose and the red head women ( sorry forgot her name) have left. Today was icing on top of the cake, after trying to call in my order for over 30mins with not one pick up of the receiver in the other end, I decided to order online, HUGE mistake...1.5 hours later for three salads! WTF guys!? Your salads are awesome but not THAT awesome. If you can't handle the online ordering service then ditch it, why shall my tummy get penalized because ya'll are unorganized!?  Let me just say this USED to be my go-to option.. Now they are last the last resort.
author: Shelley S.

description:
If you are a vegetarian and you don't like salads then avoid this place.
Other than salad they just have grilled cheese which isnt tasty and has nothing in it..but will still costs around $6
author: Ashwin D.

description:
My favorite lunch spot when I get tired of the Adobe Cafeteria food!  They always have excellent sandwiches and specials.  A half sandwich with soup is well under $8.  My pick is usually Nancy Sinatra. They also offer complimentary fresh bread with olive oil and vinegar dressing.   

Sunny cheery patio area on the sidewalk. And yes, please bus your own table afterwards.
author: Carina N.

description: So i decided that during my business trip to San Fran to stop into one of my favorite places to eat, Caffe Pazzo! They put out consistant dishes and have expertly timed staff.  I wanted for nothing and was treated like royalty. As fate would have it I asked, "who this mystery man was that was meeting my deepest culinary desires?" "Jacques, he replied." It was the SAME rock star that made my Pazzo experience a delight over a year ago! The food and the service are rock steady, if your heading into Pazzo...ask for Jacques and get the seared ahi sandwhich!
author: Corey K.

description: Pazzo's got great sandwiches and salads and a nice outdoor Seating area... I would've given 5 stars but they run put of bagels quick-style in the mornings and stop serving the breakfast menu at 10:30  grrr!
author: Diana A.

description:
While I like the food here, they have some rude servers and some of their menu options lacks logical planning. For instance, if you add chicken to any salad or if you get a sandwich "naked" (meaning they turn the sandwich into a salad), they just give you big chunks of meat instead of cutting the meat and or veggies (in the naked sandwich scenario) to bite size pieces that are appropriate for salads.
Although their menu is good, the whole huge pieces of meat and/or veggies in the salad makes no sense. Who wants to cut a huge piece of chicken up in their salad.?!?!
author: Missionette G.

description:
How did I not know this place was here. I have lived in Potrero Hill for 1 1/2 years and I had never been here? What is wrong with me? I got there at 1pm and walked right up to the counter -- no wait. 

First off, the staff was really nice. They were happy and courteous and gave me a box with a smile. A smile goes a long way sometimes. 

I had the Fellini sandwich, which has slices of turkey breast in it with a bunch of veggies. It was very good, although I should have chosen a less tough bread. But that was my own fault. My sister had the tuna sandwich with avocado which was fantastic and my boyfriend had the chicken. I only got my hands on a little bit of skin. The rest was gone before I blinked. The little bit of skin that I got was great. You can a choice of salad or potato salad. The potato salad is good. 

What I also like about this place is bang for buck. I couldn't get anywhere near finishing my sandwich, which I paid a whopping $6 for. 

I will be back :)
author: Mariko F.

description:
The seared Ahi tuna sandwich was awesome. 
Also try their flavered lattes, their coffee is top notch.
author: Coburn S.

description:
I absolutely adore this place!  My 4 star-rating for these reasons:
- Daily specials that change daily so that you keep on wanting to come back more to try new items.
- Ingredients are fresh & healthy.
- Friendly staffs.
- Online pre-ordering.
- Cleanliness of the place.

I haven't tried their "Cheap Eats", but I am sure I will one of these days as this place is becoming my regular lunch place :D
author: Kioko O.

description:
Caffe Pazzo is the place to grab lunch in SoMa. They get really busy at lunchtime, so you'll either want to order ahead of time or expect a 10 minute wait. The food is definitely worth waiting for!
If you're a fan of chicken salad sandwiches, your mind will be blown with the Nancy Sinatra - I had never had chicken salad before, because I'm not a fan of the processed mayonnaise product that you would expect, but I took a chance on the Nancy Sinatra and it was perfect! There were big pieces of chicken and all fresh ingredients. I have also had the pork barbeque sandwiches (Fridays only) and the Mike's Steak Caesar - both are excellent choices. The entree salads are filling and offer enough meat to balance things out, so you don't feel like you are eating just a head of lettuce.
As far as other reviews where people have complained about the service, I have found the employees to be pleasant - they are rushed around lunchtime, but if you are sweet to them, you might just walk out with a few pieces of bread and some oil/balsamic for dipping thrown in your order.
author: Krysta G.

description:
I usually only order from Pazzo when I'm lazy or the weather is dreadful out.  It's not that their food tastes bad that deters me from eating here more often despite it being just 3 floors down from my office.  In fact, their food tastes darn good.  However, the prices are kind of high and I tend to get super bloaty after eating here.  I haven't really figured out the real cause so I'm not going to totally point fingers just yet.  I do, however, know for a fact that I am sensitive to msg/high sodium foods and I find that every time I've had their brodo (chicken soup), I get huge migraines right after so now I stay away from it at all cause despite it's deliciousness.

There are just a couple of things I tend to order again and again and they happen to be the Roasted Chicken Club (generous amounts of chicken and thick-cut BACON!), Sourdough Tuna & Avocado (their tuna's delish with only trace amounts of mayo), and my absolute fave--the Sourdough Avocado BLT (thick-cut BACON galore!).  Every now and then they have the Egg Salad with Smoked Salmon sandwich that's pretty darn tasty as well.

The awesome thing about them is that they have daily specials which they change up pretty often.  There's ALWAYS a long line during lunch hour but it's awesome that they have an online ordering system and a separate line just for those orders--pure genius!  The ordering system has yet failed me and they're usually right on time.  The staff is uber friendly and up beat.  Never really had a problem with their customer service in the last 4+ years I've worked/patroned here.

All in all, this place is more than decent, it's just the price that keeps me from coming back often and also, my sodium issue with a few of the items on their menu.
author: Ivy Z.

description:
Why are sandwiches so expensive?  Deconstructed, the ingredients are not expensive.  Bread - there's a basket of free sliced bread and complimentary olive oil/vinegar/salt/pepper flakes.  Lettuce - I don't care if it was humanely raised, I grow most of the veg I eat so I'm IN TOUCH with the Earth.  Beef - ok, this can be a bit pricey, but not $10 pricey.

And salads?  Why are salads as expensive or more expensive than sandwiches?  Again, I'm so in touch with the earth that we hold hands every night in bed.  

I got a cup of vegetable soup here.  And about half a baguette of bread from the trough next to the door.  I used a lot of butter.  And a liberal drizzle of olive oil/pepper flakes/salt mixture.  Maybe the price is to offset the amount of bread that people like me eat.  But maybe not because bread is not that expensive.  And my cup of vegetable soup was a nearly clear broth with cubed zucchini.  It had about 90 calories.  And cost about $3.80.  How much did I pay per calorie?  

If you wear mostly all black with ballet slipper style footwear and chunky jewelry, or are slightly artsy-mostly-geeky programer type, or bourgeois-hipster shopping at the design center, you'll fit right in!  The food is really not terrible, it's just very ordinary.  Real food should have a lot of flavor, taste good, but not be blindingly expensive.
author: Christina C.

description: Was going to go to a burrito place, but I ran into this place which is also closer to work. I ordered the grilled cheese sandwich with some kind of southwestern soup that had a small bite to it. Both were delicious. The sandwich was on some kind of rye bread and had grilled onions inside. The soup was also very flavorful. I also really enjoyed the refreshing change of pace of the clientele -- I'm not sure what else is in this building, but people, mostly females, were dressed fashionably, but not overly formal as opposed to a male-dominant and casual (t-shirt/jeans) work place.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Had to drop 3 stars based on one is our party getting sick....that is just NOT acceptable!

Best place near the Jewelry/Furniture Mart by far!

So many yummy choices for sammies, salads, and piadine. They also have Peet's coffee!

You order at the counter, wait for your number, then find a table.  This worked just fine, even at noon when we were there.

I had a BLT on sour dough...wonderful high quality bacon, piled high with veggies, and wonderful lemon mayo....and a generous side salad.   Hard to finish!

When it is a "jewelry day" for one of our girls, we will definitely come back!
author: Katherine F.

description:
I love Caffe Pazzo.  The place is a little hard to find because it's located in the Design Center.  If you're planning on going for lunch during the weekday, plan to get there a little early (or order ahead) to beat the lunch crowd.  

Every time I'm in the SF office, I stop by for a cup of soup and sandwich. They have a variety of salads, hot and cold sandwiches and 2-3 soups. They also have daily specials, but I usually stick with my half-half options.  Some of their hot sandwiches can lean towards the heavier side.  Even the grill cheese can sometimes be too much with thick oozing cheese, walnut bread, a tomato paste and caramelized shallots and onions.  

Pazzo is slightly more expensive (runs about ~$10+) than my usual lunch places, but some days are just hearty lunch days.
author: Amy Y.

description: Long wait unless you order ahead. Grilled cheese and tomato soup was tiny, unfilling, and meh.
author: MakeUp M.

description:
Was looking for Pizza on yelp and came across this.
Right across the street from where I work/live, so good a reason as any to escape the work-from-home job stress and walk around in this sunny designster enclave of SOMA
Like most restaurant's here, they primarily serve the breakfast and lunch crowd for this area of spendy home furnishings and Dieter 'touch-my-monkey' lookalikes.
The ambiance was just right, nice open lofty breezeway type of space, with floor to ceiling industrial windows. (There's even an open wifi network if the iphone wasnt lying)
Food selection was good, I opted for the lunch special , some chicken of some sorts with salad, side of 1/2 garlic bread and a hibiscus iced tea for $10.
Wait wasn't terrible (I went at 230 and it closes at 3).
Some other's commented on that, but what you u really expect from ppl who work there who are prolly barely making 10/hr?

Meal was decent, I am full, and haven't gotten food poisoning, yet... (-1 start cuz some of the inner hunks of chicken were red, so I didn't eat those slivers,nor complain, just picked them off, is that caveman like?)

There is online ordering and separate pickup line, (I wanted to check it out in person)

Interesting conga line of people parading thru the place, and thus good for watching
Most amusing was the blonde from the gym next door in tights (or does she always walk around like that.. just got out of step?) and the 40ish woman in all black, whose hair appeared to get even frizzier as the 'water didn't work' and had to go back and back for silverware and other accoutremonts (the electrodes protruding from her head almost did one of those Jacobs ladder electrical arc type of things. she was so passive aggressively charged --which may be inidicative of so many friscans)

Went into unsavory paparazzi mode and snapped some pics and freaking some people out in the process (another handy use of the iphone)

I upped em too, enjoy

I'd go back, nice break from sitting at computer, staring at screen, typing...
author: G K.

description:
This place is ultra convenient if you work in the design center or nearby, I come here in the mornings for a cappuccino (half off from 8-9!) and almost every day for lunch too. Good selection of sandwiches and salads, and a bunch of other stuff I haven't tried.

The Napa salad is my favorite. Spinach and romaine lettuce, blue cheese, cranberries and walnuts, and the small size is only $5, you can get bread for free and its fairly filling. Back to the bread, you can have as much as you want and there's oil and vinegar, it really classes the place up. 

Some people have reviewed the servers here negatively, but I've never had anything but helpful, attitude-free service from them. They ask how you are, and the food comes out pretty quickly in my opinion. Plenty of seating (try the second floor for a balcony view), and its always clean.
author: Alyssa G.

description: Yo, Pazzo. Why did you change your recipe for Voodoo Noodle Thai Chicken Salad? It used to be delicious... the best special you had. Now with too much lettuce, too-thin noodles, and too-bland chicken, it's mediocre.
author: Gordon S.

description:
I have lunch here every single day.    I'm hooked on the Napa salad and Nancy Sinatra sandwich.   

Love the free bread with oil and vinegar too.

Come to think of it..  I can't wait to go to work tomorrow so I can eat here again!
author: Cindy A.

description: If you walk past on a sunny day, it smells just like Disneyland.
author: Jade L.

description: The food here is fantastic. It's fresh, creative, health-conscious, and reasonably priced. The team is very nice and friendly. I've seen a few reviews about the staff being rude or not helpful - I disagree and think there's another side to the story. They are dealing with very detail-oriented, Type-A customers who have extremely high (sometimes unrealistic) expectations. I overhear many of these types of conversations when I am waiting in line, etc., as I visit this place about twice a week, so just thought I would put another perspective on things.
author: Jake B.

description:
I like cafe Pazzo and go here sometimes for lunch. My office is a few blocks so it's a nice walk when the weather is nice. I love the Marco Pollo salad, Tuna Fattoush, and pizza's are very good. They sandwiches are big and tasty. If I'm feeling really hungry...I'll get a sandwich but can never finish the whole thing. 

This place does get busy during lunch hours. Everyone seems nice and there are plenty of tables to sit. Outdoor seating is limited, especially when it's hot outside. So if you're planning to sit outside to eat...I recommend having an early lunch. They call out a number for each order, but it's never in order. If you sit outside, you won't hear the person yelling out your number so pay attention. 

Overall, I like the area, atmosphere, service and food.
author: Erica D.

description:
These people are a**es. I've never experienced such nasty attitudes in all of my life. I was brought to this cafe by a co-worker who loves it. 

When we were ready to order, we approached the cashier and I assumed there was only ONE cashier open because the other woman had to start counting her money and wiping down her area. 

I patiently waited behind my co-worker and while I was getting my wallet out, the cleanup-cashier calls out, "Who's next!" and when I looked up she's making eye contact with the next guy in line and beckoning him over! He pauses (because he knows something funky is going down) and before I could say, "I'm next" (like haven't you seen me standing here?), she beckons to him ...even harder...waving her hands frantically with this dingbat grin on her face and says to him, "Yes, you!"

At this point, my co-worker's almost done with her order. My cashier was in training, so that's probably why he was so nice. (Gave him a tip.)

Go to the "Pick Up" area where my friend had been waiting for about 3 mins, and she asks me to hold her ticket while she runs to the restroom. No sooner than she walks off than the guy in the pick up area *glares* (yes, glares) at me so I throw him a smile like, "No, I'm not going to steal your expensive bag of Kettle Chips, especially after I just spent damn near $10 for a sandwich!"

Two minutes go by. Again, the glare. This time it's followed up with a nasty, "Do you need something from me?" So I'm confused and just responded with, "No, I'm waiting to pick up my food." He gives me a flat, "Oh," and goes back to whatever the hell he was doing. 

When my co-worker returned, I asked her, "Is this where you pick up food?" She responds, "Yeah, there's the sign right there." Dagger stares from sandwich-boy.

Needless to say, they don't ever have to worry about me going there again... EVER. Nor will I recommend it.

Too bad because the sandwich was great; but I don't like ordering food with a side order of stank-attitude.

Nor do I need to be treated like I'm not welcome, especially when I was actually born in San Francisco and not some crew of poser, wannabe yuppies trying to create a "scene" in my city.

Caffe Pazzo, get your act together!
author: Adrienne A.

description:
Amazed that I can find a good turkey-bacon-avocado-carmelized-onion-and-aioli wrap in this city for just $7.50. 

Unimpressive Mighty Leaf tea selection.

Good atmosphere.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Good prices.

Delicious salads.

Slow service.

Always busy.
author: Jono S.

description:
2 stars is for their HORRIBLE on line ordering system and the rudeness of the staff. I really like the D. Einstein salad so I'd like to give them 4 stars but I just can't. Today I placed my on line order of a salad & cup of soup at noon - received the confirmation that the order would be complete at 1:30 - this is a bit much for me as well....1.5hrs for a salad & soup? I arrive at 1:15 to pick it up and I'm told they didn't get my order. I'm then asked if I actually hit submit. I find that quite rude...then I'm asked if I received a fax confirmation - uh, who has a fax machine - no I received email. Bottom line though, once the host was done trying to blame me, she admitted they were out of fruit a key ingredient in the salad. Then just stares at me waiting for me to decide what to do now....ok, Safeway and Whole Foods are both within 1/2 mile from this place- there's no reason to run out of fruit unless they did at 1pm - a full hour after my order was placed. I changed my order - and was then told it's a better practice to speak with a human vs ordering on line. Interesting advice being given to someone in the tech industry. 

Even though I like the salad - I will no longer be ordering to go from Caffe Pazzo. It's too bad too - a simple apology and suggestion of a replacement would have done the trick for me. 

I'm thinking it might be time for some customer service training and a new on line ordering system, or just get rid of it all together.
author: Teresa J.

description:
Order online and pick up! Although the place is pretty chill to enjoy lunch if you can. Sadly, I am never able to leave the office and walk here and back in time! (Yea, I am that slow....)

You can order online and pick up at least :)

http://ordering.bigholler.com/CaffePazzo/ [link to order online]

Breakfast is served 7:30-10:30am. Lunch is served 11am-3pm.

I really enjoyed the Nico.
author: Mia N.

description:
Cafe Pazzo is our company's cafeteria. Their daily specials are great (if you can get them before it runs out) and I can always find something to cure my growling stomach. The staff is fantastic and we'll certainly miss this spot once our company moves to our new digs. 

Tips: free refills, and you can order your sandwiches "naked" to turn them into a salad.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Caffe Pazzo is alright. 
The Nick Greek Salad is really bland, and their Mediterranean Plate is too salty - their couscous and hummus are drenched in sodium. Today I ordered the Marco Pollo salad, but they forgot to give me a fork even though my order was a pick-up, and they didn't put my dressing on the side like I requested. I also ordered a Peet's tea, and all they did was give me a cup of hot water, meaning I had to go to the counter, grab a tea bag and make it myself. 

With those negatives aside though, I really do like the location of this caffe, and I LOVE that you can sit outside. I also like the fact that they just have this big box of sourdough bread for you to take. I like the online ordering service, and the staff is pretty friendly. The iced tea is good - it comes with lemon, and it's not way too sweet. The Rico salad is also really good - it has cantaloupes, grapes, walnuts, cranberries with a scoop of chicken salad. The portion of this salad is small compared to others, but i think it's just right if you eat it with the sourdough bread. :)
author: Christine A.

description: I like it!  Good salads--my favorite is the Greek salad.  Call ahead for takeout.  Insider's secret: any sandwich can be made into a salad.  Enjoy!
author: Veronica F.

description: Yay!  I see that they have rid of the bad attitude guy.  The food is still as good and thanks to the nice staff there who makes our food taste better!
author: Nanette L.

description:
All I have to say is, if you're going to here, you better get the tuna melt.  My favorite item on the menu, but it's a surefire way to food coma yourself into oblivion and drool on your keyboard for the rest of the workday.

Simple food, a little on the pricey side (nothing out of the ordinary for SF), and OK portions.
author: Jen L.

description:
PAZZO..
Plethora of palate pleasures (aka awesome tasty menu & specials)!
Perfect place (aka location location location = plenty of seating & parking). The People of Pazzo are the best of the best at least the ones I know (aka Kris & Rich & Jason?) keep me coming back..that & Peets adrenaline hour...oh and I have to bite my tongue bcoz Im crushing on one but will have to remain nameless...hoping this will get me noticed..prob not..oh well.

Im not usually one to share my real favorites but this is One to put on the map.
author: Bryan G. W.

description:
I never get sick of the Nancy Sinatra here. This huge sandwich can feed two normal people or just one fat me.  Comes with a side of either potato salad or greens (I always get the potato salad, see previous sentence).  And when I'm particularly feeling like a beast, they have some self-serve bread and balsamic vinegar.

My only gripe for this place is that if you put your order in during the lunch rush, the wait can be painfully long.  Definitely get there before 12:15pm for workday lunches.
author: Mishael K.

description:
I miss working in the financial district for the amount of dining options that were within walking distance.  Some times, there were even cafes right in my building. The SF Design Center area, on the other hand, is pretty lacking in quality lunch time options: there is a Whole Foods up the street and a few sub par places nearby so Caffe Pazzo's presence is a much needed one. 

The food served here is fresh, and they have $5 daily specials for your "budget" days. They also have sandwich and soup specials that actually DO change , unlike some places that have the same special for the entire life of their operation. The regular menu offers plenty of salads, sandwiches, etc to choose from. They even give you the option of making a sandwich into a salad. 

The line does get pretty long, but it moves relatively fast--esp if you show up just before or a little bit after the busy 12:30 lunch time. I think some of the portion sizes vary depending on what you get. Once I got a tuna sandwich that was huge while my companion got a hot sandwich that was barely enough to fill her up. 

I never have problems with seating when I'm there. It's less obvious, but they do have seating upstairs. Just watch out for that LOW ceiling if you're over 6 feet tall. The upstairs also feels a bit more private since it doesn't have the same large windows as downstairs and people are standing around you while they wait for their number to be called. 

If it was located in the FiDi, Caffe Pazzo may be easily overlooked or no more than 3 stars, but here in the Design Center vicinity, it's an oasis for those who need to eat lunch.
author: Rona J.

description: I came here with some coworkers a few weeks back and was pleased with what I found. Almost everything on the menu sounded good, so I'll be back to try some more. Their salads were quite tempting, but I eventually settled on one of their weekly specials: the turkey euro style baguette with brie and cranberry sauce. It was delicious. It also came with a side salad and the portion size was just right, I was pleasantly satisfied, not to be left hungry or overly full.
author: Krista S.

description: They offer great sandwiches and salads. The only problem is that they take very long, so it's best to call and order ahead. They may take up to 15-20 minutes depending on what you order. I like their Nancy Sinatra and Turkey Club sandwiches.
author: Sunny C.

description:
Yum! I've been working down the street from Caffe Pazzo for nearly a year now and only just tried it yesterday! I placed my order online so I could just swing by and pick it up (nice feature) but of course the line for pickups was just as long as the line for orders. Ah well. ;)

I ordered a "European baguette 2" and a cup of the wild mushroom bisque with corn. Oh man. The sandwich was delish. The sourdough baguette was so soft and chewy I could have tucked myself into it and taken a nap...but instead I threw caution to the wind and ripped off giant bites with my two front teeth (something my dentist told me never to do - whatev). The salad that accompanied the sandwich was really good - plain greens but the dressing was a sweet balsamic that was to die for. 

The soup was so rich and creamy...I'm sure between my sandwich and soup I consumed enough calories for the whole day, but it felt worth it (at the time). Everything tasted fresh and good and I will definitely go back. I'm thinking next time I'll try the Marco Pollo salad (a spin on the traditional Chinese chicken salad).
author: Carrie S.

description:
Some people judge a place's worth by how they cook Eggs Benedict. For others, it's the steak that does it for them. 

Well, for me it's salad. And Caffe Pazzo has several delicious, fresh, innovative and very healthy salads that are sure to please even the most discriminating of palates - and all for a reasonable amount of bones. 

The outdoor seating at this place kills it, too.
author: Amy Z.

description:
I waited until my third experience with Pazzo before writing a review. I work nearby, so I like to order online (which is a very easy site to navigate, in my opinion and often do the same for Dos Pinas as well), and then pick-up later. 
Shortly after I stopped eating wheat & gluten a few months ago, I emailed a contact at Mission Bay Foods to ask about the gluten-free options, to which I received a response that the following week they would begin carrying a gluten-free (GF) bread. Hooray. Later that next week, I placed my first order, being careful to mention in the comments to substitute the GF bread, as well as leave off a number of condiments that I dislike (including the salad dressing from the side-salad). I picked up my order later (it was the roast pork sandwich), and brought it back to work to eat - there was salad dressing in a little container, but other items were left off of the sandwich, so I assumed the GF bread instruction was followed. It was delicious. Later that day, I wasn't feeling so great, but figured maybe I just ate too much.
A week or so after, I ordered another sandwich (ham & cheese this time) in the same manner. When I picked it up, I was handed a container with salad, topped by the sandwich ingredients, plus a small bag with two pieces of what felt like stale bread (actually toasted. sort of.) Noticing my confused expression, the cashier somewhat embarrassingly, explained that the gluten-free bread is too small to build a proper sandwich on, so they serve the sandwich "naked" on the salad with the bread as a side. ...so the bread I had the week before was, in fact, regular wheat bread. Thanks, Pazzo. I'm particular about what I eat and the way I want it prepared, but I also hate to make a fuss, so I took my new meal and left, assembling my own awkward sandwich back at the office.
Today, prepared by what I had experienced the last time, ordered the same ham & cheese sandwich, asking for gluten-free bread and within the comments on both the sandwich part of my order as well as the general comments on the order, asked that the sandwich 'filling' be put in a separate container than the salad. Again, no condiments, no dressing. When I arrived to pick it up, it was the same as last time - ham & cheese & onions piled on top of my sandwich and bread on the side. The cashier (I think the same guy) again, looks sheepish and starts to explain about the GF bread. I tell him I already know about the bread, but had asked that the sandwich be separate from the salad so he brings it back to the kitchen window - not for them to remake, but just separate... sigh. He then rings me up and only after I get my change and am waiting for my order to I realize that they charge extra for the tiny GF bread - and that it wasn't mentioned anywhere in the online ordering. Also, I took out the side of dressing that I asked them to not include and left it on the counter. It's wasteful for it to be included if I'm just going to throw it away.
I appreciate that a gluten-free bread option is available, but if it's not big enough to serve a sandwich on, it's kind of pointless. And if the kitchen can't follow written instructions, it worries me that people might be getting served things they can't, shouldn't, or don't want to eat.
author: molly h.

description:
A nice little lunch spot. At the recommendation of a fellow Yelper I checked out Pazzos one day. They have a nice variety of sandwiches and salads on the menu, some original items as well, such as the rare seared Ahi Tuna sandwich. Although the combinations on the menu sound delicious they do leave something to be desired. I found the ahi a little bland. Oh,  in addition to your order you can pick up some bread and olive oil and vinger for free to have with your meal.

The prices are a little steep in my opinion, but I guess they are taking advantage of the limited choices of lunch venues in the area. Also I hear it gets crowded during the lunch time rush. I have not run into this problem since I grab lunch later in the day.
author: Polina S.

description: As a new employee of the area, I was pleasantly surprsied by Pazzo.  Pazzo as some of you may know translates to "crazy" in Italian and let me tell you, their sandwiches are CRAZY good!  I don't like to use the term snob when I discuss myself or food, but that's what I am when it comes to sandwiches.  Sandwich creation is a beautiful art where each bite should be well balanced and flavored.  I've had at least 7 of the sandwiches on their menu and each one is fantastic!  I have not been disappointed yet, which I think is a feat in in of itself.  If you're in the area and want a tasty sandwich or tasy breakfast or really anything else, come here.  They also offer Adrenalin Happy Hour, Mon-Fri, 8-9am where all cofffee beverages are 50% off.  Whoever thought that up, is genius!
author: Julia W.

description:
Oh, I just love this place. It's like a creative heaven on Henry Adams St. safely tucked away from the highway underpass and the grimy streets of SOMA. Here, in the design district of SF everything is shiny, preppy and inspired by Italian influences. I work off 11th & Folsom St., away from luxurious cafes that serve Pete's coffee and play melodic music. I usually eat lunch at work to save money. This was my big "lunch out" date with my co-workers.  I didn't even know this place existed, but now that I do - I must come here more often. I ordered their chili con carne, a fruit plate, a chai latte and a cupcake. We ate outside in the sun. It was like we had escaped to a small European eatery where the world is at peace and they play Sting outside all the time......

(Yes, I'm kidding here....although I do enjoy Sting.)

Pazzo is right by the SF Design Center and inside a building filled with interior design oriented show rooms. In other words, you'll see lots and lots of Designers and other fancy people dressed up like its their job to spend other people's money. 

Must plan my next trip here. Hope they'll have more tables with umbrellas in the summer time. The area is devoid of natural shade.

Checking out their Web site, it looks like they do on-line orders too.
author: Laura G.

description: I've eaten here a few times for lunch and my meal has always been tasty.  The only negative is that I've found my steak sandwich meat to be undercooked a bit, but overall the food has always been delicious.
author: Elizabeth E.

description:
Similar situation to Nanette L. happened to me. And why are Mission Bay Foods so terribly inconsistent these days? Pazzo and Dos Pinas can either never get an order correct or had forgotten to put the order in when I arrive.

Today was my first time going to Cafe Pazzo. So I placed my order online an hour before my lunch break. When I received the confirmation email, I noticed the pick-up time I selected was incorrect. So I called the number on the email and got their voicemail. Left my name, order, and ph# with an explanation that the time was wrong and how I'll still be there in an hour. The voicemail message stated that they'll call you back in 20 mins. 

No one called me back.

So I arrive and the guy behind the pick-up register couldn't find my order. I potentially expected that and was already willing to patiently wait for it to be made like anyone else, but what I didn't expect was the condescending attitude by the guy at the register. I was told that my order was scheduled an hour later. I explained their website was showing my original time, but the confirmation shown an hour later. Then he proceeds to give me a bitchy look that implied I must be mistaken or telling a lie. Then I'm told how I should order an hour ahead of time. I did. Then he tells me that I should've called them. I did, check your voicemail. Then he tells me I must've called the wrong number because "they always answer their phone" (LOL) and then proceeded to show me the correct number on their menu. I pull out my phone and show them their number matches the one I called. After that it was derp-face, uh durrr I dunno then. Really guy? I was willing to just overlook the slight with no one to blame (like I've learned to do at their other location Dos Pinas, at least those employees are nice), wait for my food, and leave ...but tacking on the condescending lecture was just an unnecessary part of my otherwise final visit.

Four stars for the food being good, but minus three stars for the employee at the register further proving that Mission Bay Foods needs to seriously get their $#!& together with their customer service.
author: Terry C.

description:
I guess the manager saw my review.  Here's her response:

Sorry you're not feeling well. 
For the record, yesterday we sold 27 orders of tuna salad and over 100 portions of the green salad and to date, yours has been the only comment we have received.
We prepare everything fresh daily, do not use leftovers, and are very serious about proper food handling, storage and cleanliness. 

We look forward to serving you again.
Please feel free to call or email if i can be of further assistance.

Thank you

Elizabeth Zipper

I wish the food poisoning was only my imagination!  I ate there on Tuesday and wasn't able to eat any regular food until Saturday and felt lilke total crap.  The sandwich was the only thing I had eaten that day.
author: Chris K.

description:
Went here for the first time last week - had the Nancy Sinatra and was simply blown away - it was so good! Everything was fresh and delicious.

The sandwich came with a side salad, and with a drink came to just under $11.

I'll definitely be visiting here again the next time I'm in San Fran.
author: Nick S.

description:
Another one of the Mission Bay Foods empire and again, good food and good value. Look out for the coffee happy hour between 8 and 9.30 for half price coffee, I get my latte there for a buck fifty, sod starbucks. They have a nice fruit/granola cup as well, although they insist in putting chocolate pieces in that for some bizarre reason.  

As for lunch, I recommend the asian salad, the meatball sandwich, pizza, baja steak sandwich, and their soup looks pretty good. All the sandwiches come with a side salad of nice greens, and they have bread, olive oil, and balsamic vinager on the side as well.
author: Karl L.

description:
I have to rate Caffe Pazzo negatively. The food was fine, but I had a bad experience that makes me not want to return here. I will explain:

I met a friend for lunch here today. We ordered separately, but right after each other. She got her food within a few minutes as expected, but twenty minutes after ordering, my order still hasn't arrived! In fact, they didn't even have my ticket in the queue when I finally came over to ask about it.

The staff and I later deduced what I suspected had happened in the first place. After I placed my order, someone else later ordered the exact same thing I did. The kindly stranger sees my order come out and accepts it as his before my number is even called, happy to receive such quick service. Meanwhile, I'm waiting outside with my friend's food getting cold. Unbeknownst to him, the stranger's order comes out and stagnates, as he as already eaten.

While I should be upset with the stranger who took my order, I never knew who this person was. A simple solution could have prevented this if the staff verified that the correct orders go to their respective patrons when they come to the counter. After all, they give us a copy of the order/ticket with the numbers printed on them. I was offered no retribution.
author: Bryan E.

description:
For the price, I think this is the best lunch place I've found in SF.  The food is high quality, reasonably priced, good portions, solid service and a nice atmosphere.

I eat here a few times/week and I never get tired of the food because they have so many creative lunch specials that there is always something new and very tasty every time.
author: Laurence M.

description:
Having passed this place on the way to work numerous times, I finally gave Caffe Pazzo a try to escape the 400th pizza lunch at my office (If I didn't know better, I'd swear we have an ownership stake in Amici's).

Anyway, a group of us tried various dishes on the menu - I opted for the Marciano Hero.  The sandwich was delicious, with a tasty marinara to complement the well-prepared meatballs.  Unlike other eateries that attempt to make a similar creation, the meatballs were moist and not overcooked to point of resembling the rubber balls you'd get as a kid from the quarter vending machines.  As a table we shared an order of the pesto garlic cheese bread, which was good but seemed to be missing something.  The side salad has a decent vinagrette, that may be a bit overseasoned for most tastes.

The seating offers both an indoor and outdoor option, which is a plus for the normally sunny SOMA neighborhood.  The only other drawbacks I could find were repeated venturing back to the counter for utensils and condiments - and unfortunately having my order take 10 minutes longer to prepare than the rest of my party.

On the whole, I really enjoyed the good food and hearty portions of Caffe Pazzo.  With the limitation of truly good options to eat around my work, Caffe Pazzo looks like a place that should consistently deliver a quality meal that sends me back to work satisfied (if a little sleepy)
author: Drew W.

description:
This will be short and sweet (unlike the line at Caffe Pazzo)
They have daily specials, although I couldn't tell you about any of them because they are always sold out by 1pm.
They have soups as well, but are usually sold out of them by 1pm.
They have good sandwiches if you have a half and hour to wait around for them.
Three stars for the quality of the food when you finally manage to get your hands on some.
author: Jamie M.

description:
My company's SF office is down the street from Pazzo & I work there once a week and usually get a Nancy Sinatra at least two out of the four times a month i'm up there (partly out of convenience, partly because it is IMO a pretty kicking good sandwich: chicken salad, bacon bits, baby greens, tomatoes, mayo on a panini roll). 

if you go here for lunch, get there before noon, because otherwise you'll wait forever for your order. Even if you get there, say @ 11:45a and order, expect to wait 10 minutes for your order to be ready. After 12:00p, you'll be lucky if you get it in 15-20 minutes. I'd give them 4 stars if there order prep wasn't so slow
author: Norm Y.

description: All items on the menu are either meaty or cheesy or both. Sorry if you don't like meat or cheese! A great sitting area. I would come back if they had more truly "vegetarian" things on the menu that weren't loaded with cheese.
author: Ryan C.

description:
I met my friend for lunch here today. I was looking forward to it, both because I miss my friend and because last time we went to Caffe Pazzo it was really good.

We both ordered the same things we ordered last time. Unfortunately, the quality has really gone down. I ordered the bleu cheese Caesar with steak. The menu says it's "grilled flank steak." The last time I order it, that's what I got, and it was great. This time, the steak was super thinly sliced roast beef. Not grilled. This was more like deli meat. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't "grilled flank steak" either.

I also ordered an iced tea. Pretty simple. I remember I liked the iced tea last night. But now instead of brewing ice tea, it's from a powder, and it's really artificial tasting. I couldn't finish it.

It's a shame, really. I think in order to cut costs in a bad economy, Pazzo has chosen to lower quality. It shows.
author: Kristen H.

description:
This is a great local place to come grab a bite to eat located inside of the S.F. Design Center.  We love coming here because of their great sandwiches, soups, and interesting specials they serve.  They always have something on their $5 (cheap eats) menu that is there throughout the week.  They will change the menu item the following week.  Their specials rotate as well and it ranges from unique salads to Vietnamese chicken sandwiches.  I always will want to try their "Phils steak Melt" because of the sliced steak that is cooked medium that just melts in your mouth.  I also like how the cheese is melted into the grilled panini style bread they serve the sandwich on.
I never get tired of coming to this place to eat.
author: Robert K.

description: I eat here once a week or so for lunch.  Marco Polo salad and the beef caesar salads are both really good.
author: Dave C.

description: I'm addicted to the pressed pork sandwich. Delicious! The Nancy Sinatra chicken salad sandwich, not so much. Not a fan of dried cranberries mixed with mayonnaise, but someone must love it. In general, everything good, with the notable exception of the meatballs, which have a sawdust-like consistency and little flavor. Portions are generous, and the ability to email an order for pickup a real plus. Biodegradable cutlery and takeout containers. Go green!
author: Antonio P.

description:
$10 sandwiches really need to be a lot better than this to get me excited.  

don't get me wrong, the food is fine.  but not great.
author: Steve S.

description:
Tasty fresh salads and big sandwiches for cheap.  Near the SOMA roundabout.   And a nice outside patio or sunny inside dining area.  Order at the counter.

Tuna and avocado sando was mushy upon mushy, but good...  Mista salad was super fresh greens, uber-candied walnuts, dried cranberries and bleu cheese.
author: Melanie C.

description:
Pazzo is here mostly to feed the office-lunch crowd, so by SF foodie standards the food's not that great (at least, my Asian Chicken Salad was unmemorable).  Still, its location in the bright and airy lobby of the Design Center is pretty neat,and if you sit at the shaded sidewalk tables on a sunny day, it's just like an al fresco lunch in SoCal.  Not bad for an ugly industrial district.

Agreed that this place experiences a major 12:00 rush, so come early or late.
author: Wes M.

description: Hooked on the pressed turkey, artichoke & fontina sandwich! Convenient location, outdoor tables available & great staff.
author: Gregg M.

description:
tomato gazpacho - OMGasmic
cesar salad - blue-cheese heaven!


this place never ceases to amaze me.
author: Marian C.

description:
Totally decent, excellent outdoor seating, and free refills on sodas.  The bonus is the tasty bread and a selection of oils/seasonings, also free.
-g
author: Greg B.

description: Yea the price is good and the sandwiches are big but everything i have tried here is just too heavy
author: Greg D.

description: I love, love, LOVE Pazzo! I am a creature of habit so I always order the same thing: The Baja Steak Sandwich. It is absolutely extraordinary with tri tip, avocado, red peppers, carmelized onions, and some sort of a wonderful sauce. It's served cold on a bread roll and comes with either green salad (the dressing is so-so) or pototo salad (which is usually very good). I highly recommend :) I just wish they were opened on weekends! Their outdoor seating is so nice on a sunny day
author: Jessica P.

description:
I love their whole menu....   Everything is prepared well and taste delicious.  The Lunch lines get a little ridiculous so if you know what you want i would highly recommend you calling before going there.  Salads, Sandwiches are delicious plus you can get small slices of bread with olive oil, vinaigrette or butter....

Downside is my co-workers more than one have mention they've seen cockroaches walking threw the counter tops.... this could have been 6 months ago or a month ago, i'm not sure.  Since I have never seen this i continue to go there, but i always try to keep an eye out just in case....    not sure what their food score card is, seems like it's worth checking out.
author: Al C.

description: I eat here very frequently because I work about 3 blocks away.  To me Cafe Pazzo has become a staple for a good clean meal.  I have never had something here that I didn't like.  Their salads are always fresh and sandos made to perfection.  One suggestion I will make is that you call your order in, around lunch it can get a little crazy so you may have to wait a bit for your food.
author: Bryan M.

description: Worth the wait, high quality and unique sandwich combos.  Love this place!
author: Patrick S.

description:
Worthy of 3.5 stars. However, I was rather disappointed with my take out order today - the sourdough BLT with green salad side. A very messy sandwich. I requested light on the mayo but it was covered in the stuff. Additionally, the sandwich is advertised as having lemon mayo, but I didn't detect any lemon at all. The bread was not as sourdoughy as I hoped either.

Previously I had the Marco Polo salad. A work colleage recommended this, calling it "stupendous." It really was a damn good salad. 

Another co-worker always orders the chicken club sandwich and loves it. I think I'm going to try that next time.

UPDATE***************

Tip for reducing wait time: phone in or email your order. It makes life so much easier. You can skip right up to the phone/fax order line to pay and pick up. It's great.

Tip for what to order: It's all about the panini sandwiches. I have had the pressed pork piccata sandwich and the turkey artichoke. Both are excellent.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Pazzo is my secret spot for when I want a good lunch by myself. It's 4 blocks away from work... and in SOMA world, that equates to 9 blocks in real world: 4 extra cuz the blocks are so big and 1 extra cuz the walk up the sidewalkless Townsend adds an extra hellish layer that makes the walk seem like forever.

But I'm glad once I get there. 

I can never decide on their delectable menu. I am trying to be healthy and Pazzo makes it fairly easy to make good-for-you choices. Although last time I was there, they had a special.... shortribs sugo over polenta. :::drrroooolll::: I was extremely tempted, but opted for a healthier soup and salad combo... of course I was jealous as I watched plate after plate come out. 

I love sitting upstairs next to the little window... makes me feel like i'm on vacation or something. Even if it is for an hour in a hectic day.

Also, I don't know what people are talking about as far as the Nick's Greek salad. i've seen a few people say it's bland. I thought it was so flavorful with really tasty herbs and great combinations of veggies. It's certainly not the same as a traditional greek salad, but none-the-less still extremely yummy.

Yes, it does take some time to get your food. But it's not so unbearable. But of course for me, it's a special treat, as my trek up Townsend is like searching for mecca. 

Okay, it ain't a religious experience or nothing, but it's still damn good.
author: Bonnie H.

description: Love this cafe great sandwiches and they have an awesome Cesar!
author: Michael W.

description:
There is nothing worse than leaving a place feeling that you made the wrong entree choice. I ordered clam chowder and a chicken sandwich instead of the spaghetti and meatballs.  In our group of five, the ones that ordered the meatball sandwich and steak sandwich were very happy with their choices.  

Initially, I thought about ordering the spaghetti and meatballs dish but then I visualized myself spilling it all over my dress shirt so I played it safe and went with the chicken sandwich.   My roasted garlic-sage chicken sandwich was good but nothing special.  I liked the asiago cheese on the sandwich and thought the aioli sauce was decent.  I didn't taste though any seasoning on the chicken and thought it was a little bland and dry.

The clam chowder wasn't creamy enough and just tasted generic.  This is a common complaint of mine in regards to clam chowder at cafes and restaurants in the city so I did not take the clam chowder into consideration with my rating of Caffe Pazzo.  

The only place I have had great clam chowder in San Francisco is at Fisherman's Wharf of all places.  Few people go to Fisherman's Wharf besides tourists or if you have a visitor in town and reluctantly agree to see Alcatraz for the eighth time.  However, I find myself at least once a month taking the cable car from Powell Street to Fisherman's Wharf with all the tourists hanging out of the cable car and taking pictures just so I can have decent clam chowder.  Once I get off the cable car and land in Fisherman's Wharf, the questions start from all directions. 

"How long are you staying in San Francisco?"  
"Where are you from?" 
"Would you like to rent a bike to go over Golden Gate Bridge?"  
"Are you interested in a day cruise around the bay? 
"How about five postcards for $1?" 
 
After talking with people trying to sell me day trips, cruises, or  five postcards for a $1, I usually watch the bushman jump out at people for a few hours but then after that, I finally grab a great bread bowl of clam chowder on the street and all is good.  

I'll keep looking for a great place for clam chowder in the city but until then, I'll take the cable car with the tourists to Fisherman's Wharf at least once a month and continue pretending to be a farmer from Iowa as I'm bombarded with people trying to sell me tourist stuff.
author: Josh K.

description:
I like this place.  It's technically more of a 3.5 but i figured what the heck and went for the full four stars.  the food is good and fresh and the tuna/avocado melt is delish.  the service is ok but the kitchen isn't the fastest due to the sheer number of people who dine here between 12 and 1pm on business days.  

never enough tables and things can get ugly outside on nice days while people jockey for tables.  really good option for SoMa workers who typically have limited food choices that are open during daytime hours.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
Cafe Pazzo is just a short stroll down the street from my office on Townsend and it is nice break from our cafeteria. It's inside the Design Center if you're having trouble finding it. 

I've been there twice and gotten the same thing both times - the Turkey and Swiss Ciabatta sandwich. I have a terrible habit of always ordering the same thing from places that I really like and I fear that I am missing out on a lot of great alternative options. Anyway, this sandwich has this amazing cranberry orange relish on it that I can't resist. The sandwich is huge and comes with a side salad, so it is a big lunch.

At 12:15 on a weekday, the wait can get long, but once you order, your food comes relatively quickly considering how many orders they are processing. There is plenty of seating (check upstairs if the tables on the 1st floor are full), including a few outdoor tables.
author: Matt N.

description:
Great lunch spot if you are in this part of SOMA.  The line can be long & slow but there is plenty of seating, even some outdoors when the weather is good.  

They make their own pizza crust from semolina daily.  That rocks my world!  AND they support local farmers & suppliers which is a major plus for me.  Fresh salads and a nice size menu for sandwiches and soups too. 

You can order in advance for pick up, and soon order & pay online so you just pick up - that will really rock my world!
author: Kathryn W.

description: I am lowering my review to 1 star because not only does this place constantly screw up on my order (even on off hours) I just tried to have a sandwhich made with substitutions and they call to tell me they can't do it.  I said that my substitution ingredients are on the menu and that I would pay more but they just said they just can't.  Um, you're a restaurant, that is your job.  If you can't (wont) do that you are pretty useless and I'm taking my business elsewhere.
author: Kaylee T.

description:
Great place for lunch if you work in the area.  Good and cheap.  
- 1 star because they tend to run out of stuff.
author: Sayeh A.

description: Good lunch specials. The napa salad is reasonably priced, as a half salad. The food is good and tasty. Orders are rushed out upon ordering.
author: Elle l.

description: I work near here so I've tried several items on their lunch menu. The first time I had the Napa salad with bleu cheese, walnuts, and cranberries. It was huge, fresh, and a good value. Since then I've tried the Greek salad and the Rico chicken salad and I was disappointed with both, they were bland and unsatisfying for the $7-8 price tag. The chicken salad I finished in like 2 minutes and I was not too happy when I had to go go back to work hungry with no cash left in my wallet to buy anything else. Oh well, I know better now. I'll give them an extra star for the service, everyone has always been friendly and they get my food out quickly.
author: Amanda D.

description: Great place for lunch, one of my absolute favorites in the area. Good variety of salads, their Mike Steak Caesar is really great
author: Kaj HeGe H.

description:
I've been working in SOMA for about 8 months, bouncing here and there for lunch, getting bored easily, never dazzled, never satisfied.  Until I found Caffe Pazzo.  I've been coming here pretty much every day for the last month and a half, and let me tell you why.

First of all, it's impossible to become bored with their menu, because of their awesome daily specials.  And they are just that...daily.  Every day, it's like a little adventure, going on the website to check out the specials.

Second of all, their prices.  I see a lot of people on here complaining that they're a bit pricey.  Nay, I say.  Having explored every food institution within a 10 block radius, I challenge you to find a place that is not only cheaper but better tasting.  You may find one or the other, but not both.

Thirdly, (is that a word?) the ease of ordering.  I place my order online at about 11 every morning, and schedule to pick it up at 1:00, which is when I take my lunch.  And it's always ready for me.

The people who work there are very friendly.  Especially the guy who normally works at the register when I get there.  He recognized me the second time I came in, so now when he sees me walk in the door, he magically has my order sitting next to him when I get to the front of the line.  And it's not like I have a unicorn horn, or wear a kimono, I don't stand out in a crowd, and seeing how crowded it gets in there, that impressed me.  And now I suddenly feel like a very big jerk for not knowing his name.  Note to self: ask nice dude his name.

So, back to the food... When nothing on the daily specials really catches my eye, I have a standard staple that I always order, that hasn't let me down yet.  Soup and salad...boring you say?  Oh no.  For $6.50 you get a beautiful, rather large salad that contains fresh greens, dried cranberries, candied walnuts and blue cheese, with a yummy vinaigrette, and a generous portion of your choice of soup.  They always have 3 to choose from, 1 of which changes daily, 1 of which is always gazpacho with an add-prawn option (haven't tried that one, not too crazy about cold soup), and the last is always their vegetable and orzo soup which is surprisingly good.  When I first ordered it, I thought it looked bland, but the broth is very flavorful, and all the veggies in it are always still crisp, never soggy.   So I get that, grab a couple of free slices of really good French bread that they leave out, and bada bing, lunch of champions.

I have ordered a few things which I thought were meh.  But I do not blame Pazzo, I only blame myself.  I don't like sun dried tomatoes, so why would I order something with sun dried tomatoes in them?  I don't know, but I did.  One time I ordered a sandwich special they had with so many ingredients that I couldn't even imagine what it would taste like (seared ahi, avocado, pineapple and cheese, among other things.)  I thought it could have done without at least one of the ingredients.  But I applauded their creative effort.

Their normal seared ahi tuna sandwich on their menu is really very good.  That's another basic I'll order, on a Friday (because it's $9, so it's a treat) if nothing on the specials menu screams at me.

All in all, I'm into Pazzo.  It makes me happy.

****Was just there again today.  Nice dude introduced himself to me.  His name is Rich, for your information.  I'm a little slow on the uptake, and it wasn't until after I left that I thought to myself "Hmmm, maybe he read my Yelp review."  If so, then he knew who I was, and that, again is impressive."***
author: Cat R.

description: Already off to a good start with the house granola for breakfast, the massive chicken sandwich on a panino roll for lunch sealed the fifth star. Complete with side salad and at only $6.50, it felt like a steal.
author: Jason B.

description: Love this place. Great food, convenient online ordering so you can skip the long lines at lunchtime, specials that change daily, and a nice setting. What more could you want from a workday lunch spot?
author: Emily E.

description: This IS a Mission Bay owned restaurant, & is part of the reason for my 3 stars; the food served here is almost EXACTLY the same as what's offered at my job's cafe, only it costs MORE.  Make sure that you call in advance; otherwise, the wait can be pretty ridiculous.  Their service earned them their 2 stars; they do employ some very nice folks.  However, the pricing is entirely too expensive for the quality of food (it's fresh, but the taste is mediocre-aiite at best)...what I DON'T understand is how their food actually tastes BETTER than what's produced at our cafe? hmmm...
author: Amoura B.

description: Yep, it's a bit overpriced...but the counter folks are very nice and they always have something with bacon that is much needed for me most afternoons. Try the Nancy Sinatra or Rico Salad, or you can really get a bang for your buck and get the $5 BBQ Chicken special, which is a huge thigh with salad. They have other yummy daily specials too.
author: Colleen B.

description: working in the design center area, there aren't that many food options...at least, so you think!  Caffe Pazzo offers healthy lunch options, online ordering and unique side items!  Try their daily lemonade specials (watermelon--YUM!) or their North Beach BLT on onion focaccia...it's delicious!!
author: Michelle B.

description: The best thing about Pazzo is the price. For about $8, you can order a good portion sandwich and salad - good quality food too. They are always packed at lunch but accept phone and online reservations. However, seating is sometimes limited during the lunch rush.
author: Brian W.
