description: aka Cafe Pazz-Slow, and part of the Mission Bay Foods Empire, go here if you like long lunch breaks, hate working, and enjoy watching 5 different employees struggle to use a credit card machine. The food is okay, they have variety. You can order online, which is fun because you stand and laugh at the 20 people waiting in line while, well, you wait just slightly less than them. They have a bbq chicken "special" that never changes, which is pretty much the most un-special special that ever specialed.
author: Heavy B.

description: Great lunch spot, and like others have put, the Marco Pollo salad is very good. Highly recommend Caffe Pazzo for lunch.  Food is stellar.
author: Justin G.

description: Great price for fantastic lunchtime treats.  I wish I were in the SOMA more often so I could try everything on the menu.
author: Carrie A.

description: Good for lunch if you work in this area. Can be a bit pricey at times but it depends on what you good. They have good soups, a fab Ceasar salad and great fruit flavored lemonades and iced teas. They are a bit slow and  some of there specials are completely flavorless but considering the options in this neighborhood I eat here like twice a week
author: PAULA W.

description: I really really like this place.  Me and my coworker go here sometimes for lunch.  They have a good variety of food from sandwiches to soups to salads, all DELICIOUS and with pretty good prices.  The owner owns Dos Pinas as well which I love too.  Their split pea soup is TO DIE FOR-its soooo delicious and has sweet yam bits in it and bacon bits and comes with a side of this toasted garlic bread and all for only like $2.95! yummm
author: Renee S.

description:
This is my favorite lunch place close to work. Great food with a wonderful variety. Fresh new daily specials as well as a very good regular menu of tasty treats.

Great staff and a decent value.

Highly recommended. Only knock is it gets crazy busy at lunch time but who can fault everyone for wanting lunch there.
author: David S.

description: I had the mushroom chicken risotto soup today and it was delish! The grilled cheese was on crunchy bread with nuts and was melted with shallots, but there was too much grease from the cheese and butter. It was a good deal for a mini sandwich and soup though ($6). I usually go here when I need to hit up the B of A across the street since the wait can take up to 15 minutes and they are pretty packed at lunch. More seating is available on the mezzanine level and the dining area receives lotsa light.  Parking can also be a drag.
author: Kim G.

description: Okay, I love the soup/grilled cheese sandwich combo... other sandwiches pretty good, best soups I've had so far are the chicken chowder and the tomato soup. Prices are okay, a little high but normal for the city. My biggest gripe... okay, is it just me or does this place just SMELL weird!? The smell always hits me and until my nose is able to normalize it, I just find it pretty offensive... like a bathroom odor, really. Everyone I've been with has said they'd either sort of smelled it or don't really mind, and their major problem is the seating on the first floor. Still, consistently been good for lunch.
author: Jessica L.

description: AMAZING Granola+Yogurt+fruit CUP!!!  So good and they don't skimp on the fruit!  They run out fast so get there early!
author: Ny H.

description: Someone on Youth Speaks staff eats at Caffe Pazzo almost daily. The staff is always friendly and courteous, and we feel at home here. It's a little pricey, but if you've got the inclination and the budget, they've got the best Watermelon Lemonade in town. Check them out.
author: Chinaka H.

description: I've been to this place a couple of times and thought the sandwiches were pretty tasty.   I had the Nancy Sinatra sandwich and also the Marciano Hero sandwich.  My coworkers had the pizzas and also thought they were pretty good.  I suggest it's a good place to go for lunch if you work in that area.
author: JenJen W.

description: I like the food here. I always order to go online or I go early so that I beat the big crowds. I like the salads a lot. The sandwiches are okay. The service has always been good to me. I haven't had to wait for very long and I never have to wait if I order online. The trick is not to show up at 12:30 expecting to get your sandwich or salad in 5 minutes. There is usually a like of at least 10 people and another 5-6 people waiting on their orders. There aren't many options in this area, and this is a good one!
author: Krystal S.

description: The food here is very fresh (Salads, Sandwiches) and good. Very crowded so either have to get their early or really late. But if you go late, usually they run out of their daily specials. Prices are very high for lunch. At least $7-8. Here's a tip. You can order online and go straight to the pick up line otherwise you'll be waiting 10 minutes in line and another 10-15 minutes for your food.
author: Roger C.

description: Well executed healthy choices.  Thats how I'd describe this place.  Everything is made fresh, including their soups.  They have a daily and fixed menu that covers mostly any sandwich or salad fix.  Loving the reggae station they have playing during lunch, not to mention that that corridor of SOMA is a pretty interesting place.
author: bayani p.

description: I really don't like to write reviews at this site but I'm writing to Chris, hey fellow Chris get real and a hobby, in other word get your butt off  your computer " matrix  world" you put yourself in and have a life instead of your dull paragraphs, don't know how people like you Chris have all the time between there hands  to write lengthily tedious reviews,. Good luck Chris out there from my heart.
author: sweetie p.

description:
I've got to start by saying it's a shame there are so many primadonnas who have written about this place. The complaints I've read below are pretty pathetic you bunch of whiners. 

Granted I've only been eating here for about two months, I'll say that in that time, it's been consistently good, sometimes delicious, sometimes, just good. But consistent, quick (for the quality of food) and in the last few months sitting outside is so awesome. 

Since it's a grab and go joint, I don't need to critique any more than saying the staff is as courteous as they need to be. They say thank you and get the job done. 

I love the Steve's special of half pizza and half ceaser salad. I have the Einstein (tuna) salad a lot, and I think that needs more lettuce with it, but it's still just fine. The hot sandwiches are good and I want to try the blue cheese steak salad but haven't got there yet.
author: Eric D.

description: Always good food and great prices. They definitely have a line at lunch time. I've had about 6 different dishes and they were all really good. Some outdoor seating and lots of indoor seating. There are only a couple of place to plug in a computer, but they have open, free wifi which makes it easy to stop by and surf the interwebs at lunchtime.
author: Terrance W.

description: can i give it half a star for convenience? rude guy at the counter and overpriced food.
author: Laurie P.

description:
Interior Designer eatery at the Design Center.
The Nancy Sinatra changed my life...chicken salad with bacon!  Oh my!
I used to get it in sandwich form with a side of potato salad (also a life changer) but then I get it what they call "naked" which is just on a bed of mixed greens.  The line can get really long after noon...so I say get there early to stand in line and get a table.  They give you free refills on drinks too!
You can fax in an order too...
author: Presidio H.

description:
so easy n breezy...

i like this place b/c:

1.) it's CHEAP - i can walk outta there full on less than $5.  i really like the $5 CHICKEN CHIPOTLE special they have on certain weeks.  the chicken is yummy, flavorful, and not dry.  i also like the NAPA SALAD w/ blue cheese... the small size is enough for lunch for me.. and for less than 5.  also, free self-serve bread.

2.) it has DELICIOUS n SIMPLE food options... salads, sandwiches, and soups... all unassuming yet satisfying.  this is a popular place, so get here before lunch time... or CALL AHEAD to put in your order before you get there so you can bypass the line.

3.) there's OUTDOOR SEATING

4.) and FEELS GOOD .... and lotsa windows, lotsa space, lotsa tables and chairs
author: Christina L.

description: i ordered the house salad which consists of spinach, cranberries, feta cheese, and honey walnuts. it was DIVINE.  very generous portions of feta cheese and cranberries.  the outdoor dining in the sunshine made it all too sweet.  on the pricier side, but it's worth it.
author: Amy Z.

description:
I think the food there is ok though the portions are much smaller than the previous years. Instead of keeping the portions the same size they reduced the portions....NOT the prices that are even higher!
Besides that the manager is ABSURDLY rude, unfriendly and not sincere! She is a latino always with her hair pulled back, little spectacles on, unfriendly cold face. I just can't get it! How someone like that could possibly work into customer services??/ How does someone like that get job dealing with customers? She should be fired! She used to manage Dos pinas restaurant. I just can't see how she got these jobs? Just for being friends with the owners...friends with benefits! And right after she lives Pazzo she goes to the buildings around the design center collecting cardboard boxes in a white truck! 
She is more a truck driver than a customer oriented person! If she HATES dealing with customers/clients (obviously she does by the way she treats customers/clients) she SHOULD NOT be working there! Go figure!
author: karl g.

description: Good place to get lunch if you work in the area! They have daily specials that include different salads, sandwiches, and pizzas. Their soups change everyday. What I like about this cafe is that they have options for pizza and salad, sandwich and salad, soup and salad, and other such combinations. Even a little grilled cheese and soup. Yum. Pretty reasonably priced, I'd say usually 8-12 bucks for lunch. Their soups are almost always good (chicken chowder and tomato soup and curry chicken soup). If you come at noon tho, be prepared for a wait. This cafe is the type where after you get in line to order, they call out your number and you pick up your food. It's sometimes really slow to get your food once you've ordered and they're really busy! Tips: They post their menu on their site everyday! Also they provide free bread by the pick up counter as well as olive oil and vinegar to eat with it! Call in or fax your order too!
author: Christine L.

description: this place is absolutely delicious! if i could have pazzo for lunch everyday, i'll be one happy girl. everything on their menu is just yummmm! if you've never been there before and thinking about going there, don't think, just go! oh, and order the fellini w/ the garden salad. omg, their balsamic vinaigrette is to die for. i have yet to find another place w/ that yummy dressing. mmm..mmm.. so good!
author: mai c.

description: i recently discovered caffe pazzo, and i absolutely love it for lunch. the sandwiches are delicious and they come with a generous side salad. a gourmet but affordable lunch. love it!
author: Kerri B.

description: The Marciano (meatball) sandwich is excellent.  I also like the tuna avocado melt.  Why is everyone on here complaining about the prices?  $8-10 for a good-sized sandwich and side salad is fairly reasonable.
author: C H.

description: i work in the area and this place is ok. the line for lunch is ridiculous!!!! the food is not bad, but they can't seem to hold it down when it gets busy and with a 45 min. lunch you can only wait so long. So I haven't been back in a while but if you are shopping at the design center and you have no "lunch" time go here and get an outdoor seat if it's nice out and enjoy yourself and not care about the wait.
author: Ariana M.

description: Pretty good fare.   (Mediocre service, but what you can you expect these days in a place like this?)   But c'mon, Pazzo, when barbecue chicken is on the daily special list for over a year, it's no longer a special!
author: Anne S.

description: Yes, the food at Pazzo is tasty and fresh, they use ingredients from local farmers, and their portions are huge... BUT... and this is a big BUT for me... they just take WAY too long, every single day! And God forbid that you have to make any substitution on your order... like I do because of acid reflux... I believe that  they never knew how popular they would become, so they are not prepared to serve so many people. They need to come up to speed PRONTO! Despite the chaos, kudos to Norma for trying to make it work every day!
author: Digna R.

description: Food is generally good but if it were cheaper, I'd consider it great food.  I miss the veggie burger with the garlic aioli -- that was a good healthy lunch alternative.  Sometimes the salads are swimming in dressing.  Service is okay, sometimes comes with an attitude, but that's to be expected when few customers drop the change in the tip jar.
author: Frank Q.
